ThingDef.label: elephant
ThingDef.description: The largest unmodified land animal. It can use its tusks as tools for moving objects - or as deadly weapons.

ThingDef.label: rhinoceros
ThingDef.description: This large land mammal is typically quite peaceful, but it will not hesitate to charge with its horn to fend off trespassers.

ThingDef.label: gazelle
ThingDef.description: A small, extremely quick antelope known for its amazingly long leap.

ThingDef.label: ibex
ThingDef.description: The hardy wild ancestor of the domesticated goat. Ibexes live on marginal territory that most antelopes couldn't survive, eating lichens and sparse mountain plants. They're famous for dextrously hopping across bare cliff faces - and for their violent ramming attack.

ThingDef.label: deer
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized herding herbivore. Generally peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: elk
ThingDef.description: A large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: caribou
ThingDef.description: A large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: alpaca
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized ungulate closely related to the llama, the alpaca is often farmed for its remarkably soft wool.

ThingDef.label: chinchilla
ThingDef.description: A small but quick rodent famous for its exceptionally soft fur.

ThingDef.label: cobra
ThingDef.description: A large snake. Cobras can be highly aggressive if provoked - it's better to stay away from these creatures.

ThingDef.label: monkey
ThingDef.description: This monkey can use its curly tail to grab on to branches, leaving its hands free to do other things.
